decision_conditions: The cumulative impact of extending the hours of the proposed use of the premises would be likely to result in a greater degree of coming and goings at the quieter period of time in location surrounded by domestic neighbouring buildings. Consequently, inevitably  the proposal would result in an unacceptable levels of noise and disturbance to the amenities of such occupiers at the time when the nearby residential occupiers expect a degree of calm and tranquillity. The noise and the associated disturbance would be further aggravated when the existing car parks continue to be used by the patron late in the evening and in the early hours of the morning in which case, there would be additional noise and light pollution associated with vehicles manoeuvring, harmful to the residential amenity of neighbouring properties contrary to Policies 7 and 34 of the Local Plan 2021.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the agent on 14th. April 2025.
description: Variation of condition No. 5 (Opening hours) of planning permission P1225.23 dated 26/01/2024 to allow for an extension of hours whereby the premises shall not be used other than between the hours of 11am and 10pm all week (Variation of condition no. 2 of planning permission P0450.21 dated 5th April 2022, to extend hours of use to Monday to Friday 12:00-19:30, Saturday, Sunday and Bank Holidays 12:00-17:30)
